Key Match Events: Keshav Maharaj took two wickets in the final over
Bangladesh could manage only 109/7 in 20 overs
Heinrich Klaasen (46) and David Miller (29) took their team past the 100-run mark
Pacer Tanzim Hasan Sakib took three wickets for Bangladesh
Post-Match Reflections: Aiden Markram, the captain of South Africa, says that everyone was going to be pretty nervous in this sort of a final over finish and sometimes you get over the line and sometimes you don't but it makes for great entertainment
On his crucial catch, he says that it was a matter of a meter or two and reckons they got a bit lucky at times
Aiden Markram adds that the partnership between David Miller and Heinrich Klaasen and is happy to see them doing well at crucial times
Najmul Hossain Shanto, the captain of Bangladesh, says they were nervous but they were hopeful that Jaker Ali will help win the match but this things happen in cricket
Feels they should have won the match but tells South Africa bowled well in the last couple of overs
Mentions Rishad Hossain is very good, he works hard and is showing his skills, says they are lucky to have him
Heinrich Klaasen is the Player of the Match for his gritty batting performance
Klaasen starts by saying that it feels good that the boys got over the line
Adds that the wicket isn't great for stroke-play but they had good information from David Miller about the wicket from the last game and managed to put on a decent total
Mentions he and Miller had a One-Day mindset and wanted to shift gears after the 15th over which unfortunately didn't happen
Ends by saying that they have got three games out of the way, winning all of them and will now look forward to the next stage
Miscellaneous Highlights: Aiden Markram took a huge, huge gamble by batting first on a slow, soft pitch
Bangladesh were reeling at 50/4 at one stage and were in similar position to South Africa
Towhid Hridoy and Mahmudullah came to the rescue and put on a solid stand of 44 runs before Hridoy was dismissed
Mahmudullah, in the back of his mind made the decision to target Keshav Maharaj in the final over but his plan got wasted as he hammered a low full toss in the hands of Markram
He fell and the onus was on Jaker Ali but he too failed to hit the winning runs
The Streak remains intact! It's 9-0 to South Africa in T20s
Bangladesh need 11 runs from 6 balls. Keshav Maharaj has one over left. It could be a gamble but Aiden Markram has no other options left
Keshav Maharaj with a body blow to Bangladesh and not only is it a wicket but the new man will be on strike as well with Mahmudullah stranded at the other end
Others: South Africa have virtually registered their names in the Super Eight but by no means they have played their best cricket yet
They have had to be really clutch in all three matches
Today as well, they registered a very low total as the batters failed yet again
South Africa were 23/4 but then came the match-winning partnership between David Miller and Heinrich Klaasen
The duo added 79 runs but South Africa failed to get the required finish in the fag end of the innings
However, the bowlers stepped up, kept chipping in with wickets regularly and it was in the last couple of overs where they really showed the grit to get the two points
Keshav Maharaj, in particularly showed his experience in the final over
